result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Fudala

defendant.name: Fudala, Thomas
defendant.address: 100 Corrections Drive, Stanley Correctional Institution 558554, Stanley, WI 54768

records.addlTxt:
10:13 AM Defendant Thomas Fudala appeared by phone.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Thomas Fudala.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
***Refused to sign*** No contact with AS or the children listed as 1-4 in the criminal complaint. $5000

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 008713,
Payable Number: 136358,
Receipt Number: 22R 006997,
Amount: $20.00

3:37 PM Defendant Thomas Fudala appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Thomas Fudala. 
Alan Neinast is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney McGrath. He is a detective with the Marshfield Police Department. On 11/18/21, he was called to assist Human Services at a residence. There children were living with the defendant and Amber Shover. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. One of the children reported an incident that had occurred on or about 7/1/21. He was instructed to clean his room and defendant found some Legos under the bed and defendant became abusive to him. Testifies as to his injuries. Another child stated injuries that he had received in the home on or about 4/20/21 and his mom would not send him to school.  Both defendant and Amber were working and worked during the night. They made arrangements for the upstairs neighbors to watch over the children but they did not stay in the apartment. Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness.  Attorney McGrath redirects.  Attorney Slattery cross-examines witness.
Attorney Slattery makes statement.
Attorney McGrath makes statement.
Attorney Slattery makes additional statement.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.

No contact w/ AS or the children listed as 1-4 in the criminal complaint.

**Copy of Fax Cover Sheet from Wood County Jail to Stanley Correctional w/ a response that defendant refuses to sign the signature bond, and a copy of the signature bond showing defendant refused**

1:16 PM Defendant Thomas Fudala appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Thomas Fudala.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim MR appears in court by telephone.

Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. Defendant waives time limits.
